channel.title: Esepon LOL Look
channel.description:
Ok, so in the espeon run.cmd file
it has this:
[code]@echo off cd ../build "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" net/com/espeon/Server 43594 [/code]
In Mac OS X I got the run.cmd to work with mac OS X: [code]cd ~/Desktop/lol/bin/ java -Xmx256m server [/code]
But when i run it with mac i get this error: [code]Last login: Sat Dec 19 16:34:38 on ttys000 /Users/Cerda/Desktop/lol/bin/run.cmd ; exit; Anthony-Cerdas-MacBook-Air:~ Cerda$ /Users/Cerda/Desktop/lol/bin/run.cmd ; exit;Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:315) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:330) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:250) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:398) logout
[Process completed] [/code]
It's because I don't know how to make it find this [code]net/com/espeon/Server 43594[/code]
So I don't know where to place that code in the run.cmd when using mac os x. I can run other servers with mac but not espeon because of that

item.title: Esepon LOL Look
item.dc:creator: @Aurelia Aurelia
item.description:
@Aurelia wrote:

lol oh well we failed =p thanks anyways

Read full topic

item.title: Esepon LOL Look
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

… If this doesnt work I’ll eat my beret.

Try placing the cmd file in the cmd/source folder(or any other subfolder other then build or bin). And use this command:

@echo off
cd ../build
java net/com/espeon/Server 43594

It the same as the orginal cmd, but without the path to java in quotations.

Read full topic

Hey thanks for helping me so much, No one else would really help this much.

I don’t know whats wrong, but i got this, everything u put in the code seems correct so idk why its not working.

[code]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: net/com/espeon/Server

@relmitos wrote:

cd ~/Downloads/espeon/bin/
java -Xmx256m net/com/espeon/Server 43594

-cp is not necessary.

item.title: Esepon LOL Look
item.dc:creator: @Aurelia Aurelia
item.description:
@Aurelia wrote:

Is this correct? cd ~/Downloads/espeon/bin/ java -Xmx256m -cp net/com/espeon/Server

I got this which is cool but idk what it means =p

[code]Last login: Sat Dec 19 17:21:32 on ttys000
/Users/Cerda/Downloads/espeon/bin/run.cmd ; exit;
Anthony-Cerdas-MacBook-Air:~ Cerda$ /Users/Cerda/Downloads/espeon/bin/run.cmd ; exit;
Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)

where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
-d64 use a 64-bit data model if available (implies -server, only for x86_64)
-client to select the “client” VM
-server to select the “server” VM
-jvm is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
-hotspot is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
The default VM is client.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A : separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
                see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument
-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

logout

[Process completed]
[/code]

item.description:
@Aurelia wrote:

Ok, so in the espeon run.cmd file

it has this:

@echo off cd ../build "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" net/com/espeon/Server 43594

In Mac OS X I got the run.cmd to work with mac OS X:

cd ~/Desktop/lol/bin/ java -Xmx256m server

But when i run it with mac i get this error:

[code]Last login: Sat Dec 19 16:34:38 on ttys000

Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server

I can run other servers with mac but not espeon because of that
